pros: Solid place to work with decent pay and great benefits
cons: Pay could be better along with better staffing.

pros: I only worked there for a year, but I recommend it if you are looking for a stable environment with benefit options and good health insurance

review_title: Job satisfaction depends on your department/your director
pros:
Monday-Friday 
co-workers were friendly
Nice/clean facilities
cons:
- Unprofessional director
- Well Below average pay for therapists
- Required to clock out if patients did not show 
-Micromanaged 
-poor on job the job training
-complicated computer/documentation program, again little to no training
- Very obviously profit driven
- Poor patient scheduling for outpatient. would often have 3-4 hour breaks between patients the middle of the day in which I was required to clock out. 
- Scheduled to see pt's in which certifications should have been required (pt should have seen certified hand therapist, not a new grad)
-no budget for necessary supplies
-never received portion of my final pay check


Above all else, you will be treated as a way to make the hospital money and nothing else. Director does not care about personal work life balance.

pros: Love working in the community
cons: Growth and development because most people that work here stay and stay for years.
